coded_answer.p: I am writing this letter to you to showpoint out the difference between your advertisement for Over The Rainbow and thewhat happened in real life.

When I saw your advertisement onin yesterday's newspaper, I thought that I would have a perfect evening as you have writtenwrote onin your advertisement. But now I am thinking that it was a waste of time.
I am a fan of Danny Brook and he was one of the reasons why I chose seeingto see Over The Rainbow, but I didn't even see him on the stage.

Moreover it was written in the advertisement that the musical was between 14:30-19:3014.30 and 18.30. SuprisinglySurprisingly the show started at 20:15. That destroyed all my plans. Then I decided to have a dinner at your Theatre Restaurant after the show, but unfortunately it was closed.

I think, all of these disappointments are too much for one evening. After allAll in all I am sure that you understoodhave understood it wasn't my perfect evening out and you will give me my money back.
I am looking forward to hearing your good news.
Unfortunately, Pat wasn't very good at keeping secrets. That was also my fault. I don't know why I told this to Pattold Pat this. But I thought Pat and I were best friends.

Yesterday Larry suggested going to the cinema after school. This was the most wonderful suggestion I have ever had. Going to the cinema with the boy I love. It sounded really good. Of course I accepted immidiatelyimmediately. I was like walking onin the clouds for the whole day until I saw Pat running towards me. I suddenly remembered that I promisedhad promised Pat tothat I helpwould help her with her history homework. She came nearup to me and said "Ready for this evening? Don't forget bringingto bring your history books." She was very nervous because she was about to fail. I told her that I wantwanted to tell her something. Then I explained what hashad happened that morning. She was about towas going to cry. "I see. You chooseare choosing Larry, but I thought that I was your best friend." After hearing this, I told her that I am deeply in love with Larry. I told her not to tell this anyoneanyone this. She said OK angrily.

After school Larry and I went to the cinema, but onat the enteranceentrance there was a beautiful girl waiting for us. Larry told me that she is his girlfriend and then I told them I had to go home. When they asked me the reason I told them that I promised my Mom to bestay in with her. They said OK and I went home. When I closed my bedroom'sbedroom door I burst into tears. I don't know how long I cried...
Next morning I went to school again. Everyone at the school was knowingknew about my love tofor Larry including him. Pat was the only person who knewhad known about it.
That showed me not to trust anyone.
